name: Soko-Ban 84
overview: Remake of the game Soko Ban released in 1982 and presented at AmiGameJam21 . Coded in AMOS, this is the first tukinem game. The game has 53 levels. There are three display modes to choose from: CGA, Tandy, and Amiga. Soko-Ban is a classic puzzle game, the basis of many clones in recent years. It is installed in a warehouse. At each level, the player must push crates (from square to square) to bring them to the designated places; once each crate is in a marked location, the level is complete. Crates can only be pushed one at a time (so two side-by-side crates can't be pushed together) and can't be pulled - so it's possible to get a crate stuck in a corner, where it can't be recovered! At the later levels, you need to plan 40 stages in advance. Updates in 2022 added Dual Playfield and high scores.
